string-array.name: descriptions
string-array.item: Activity is a Java code that supports a screen or UI. In other words, building block of the user interface is the activity.
A service is a component that runs in the background to perform long-running operations without needing to interact with the user and it works even if application is destroyed.
A content provider manages access to a central repository of data. A provider is part of an Android application, which often provides its own UI for working with the data.
An intent filter specifies the types of intents to which an activity, service, or broadcast receiver can respond to by declaring the capabilities of a component.
